Last Published: 2014-12-29  | Version: ${project.version}

PMD Results

The following document contains the results of PMD 5.2.1.

Files

DontCatchGenericException.java

ViolationLine
Avoid catching generic exceptions such as NullPointerException, RuntimeException, Exception in try-catch block12
Avoid catching generic exceptions such as NullPointerException, RuntimeException, Exception in try-catch block14

DontCatchNPE.java

ViolationLine
Avoid catching NullPointerException; consider removing the cause of the NPE.9
Avoid catching generic exceptions such as NullPointerException, RuntimeException, Exception in try-catch block9

DontCatchThrowable.java

ViolationLine
A catch statement should never catch throwable since it includes errors.15

DontDeclareThrowsExceptionInSignature.java

ViolationLine
A method/constructor shouldnt explicitly throw java.lang.Exception6

DontExtendJavaLangError.java

ViolationLine
Exceptions should not extend java.lang.Error4

DontLoseExceptionInformation.java

ViolationLine
Avoid statements in a catch block that invoke accessors on the exception without using the information10

DontReThrowException.java

ViolationLine
A catch statement that catches an exception only to rethrow it should be avoided.9–11

DontThrowExceptionInFinally.java

ViolationLine
A throw statement in a finally block makes the control flow hard to understand.14–18

DontThrowNPE.java

ViolationLine
Avoid throwing null pointer exceptions.6

DontThrowNewInstanceOfSameException.java

ViolationLine
A catch statement that catches an exception only to wrap it in a new instance of the same type of exception and throw it should be avoided9–12

DontThrowRawExceptionTypes.java

ViolationLine
Avoid throwing raw exception types.7

DontUseExceptionsForFlowControl.java

ViolationLine
Avoid using exceptions as flow control.15
